title: Non-normative Decision-Making in Higher Education Institutions and Instructional Design Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of foundational instructional design theory and practical experience
context.additional_context: Learners are current practitioners with experience in complex decision-making structures within educational institutions, aiming to strengthen instructional design competencies in language education domains

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more strategies to flexibly adjust the instructional design process in non-normative decision-making environments.
Learners can propose methods to resolve ethical conflicts in educational design by utilizing reflective practice and reflective advocacy.
Learners can establish and implement a concrete action plan to respond to uncertain decision-making structures in large-scale online environments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
